options.content: Requirement Metrics

panels.description:
1. The average lead time of requirements.
2. Lead time refers to the length of time from requirement creation to delivery.
3. The requirements being calculated are filtered by "requirement resolution time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board"("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
select 
  now() as time,
  avg(lead_time_minutes/1440) as value
from jira_issues ji
  join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
where 
  std_type = 'Requirement'
  and std_status = 'Resolved'
  and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
  and jbi.board_id = $board_id
group by 1;

panels.title: Avg Requirement Lead Time (day)

panels.description:
1. The lead time at which 80% requirementsâ€˜ lead time lies below it.
2. The requirements being calculated are filtered by "requirement resolution time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    ji.lead_time_minutes,
    percent_rank() over (order by lead_time_minutes asc) as ranks
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select
  now() as time,
  max(lead_time_minutes/1440) as value
from _ranks
where 
  ranks <= 0.8
group by 1

panels.title: 80th Percentile Requirement Lead Time (day)

panels.description:
1. The average requirement lead time over time.
2. The time granularity can be switched to Week or Month by "Time Interval" above. 
3. When Time Interval is set to "Month", the average_lead_time of "2021-06-01" refers to the average lead time of requirements whose resolution time falls under [2020-06-01, 2020-07-01).

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select 
    DATE_ADD(date(resolution_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(resolution_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    lead_time_minutes
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  timestamp(time) as time,
  avg(lead_time_minutes/1440) as average_lead_time
from _requirement
group by 1
order by 1 asc

panels.title: Requirement Lead Time over Time

panels.description:
1. The cumulative distribution of requirement lead time. 
2. Each point refers to the percent rank of a lead time.

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    round(ji.lead_time_minutes/1440) as lead_time_day
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
  order by lead_time_day asc
)

select 
  now() as time,
  lpad(concat(lead_time_day,'d'), 4, ' ') as metric,
  percent_rank() over (order by lead_time_day asc) as value
from _ranks
order by lead_time_day asc

panels.title: Requirement Lead Time (Cumulative Distribution)

panels.description: The average lead time of requirements under different Jira Epics.

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select
    ji.issue_id,
    epic_key,
    ji.lead_time_minutes
  from
    jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    ji.std_type = 'Requirement'
    and ji.std_status = 'Resolved'
    and ji.epic_key is not null
    and ji.epic_key != ''
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  now() as time,
  epic_key as "Epic Key",
  avg(lead_time_minutes/1440) as value
from _requirement
group by 1,2
order by 3 desc
limit 20

panels.title: Average Requirement Lead Time by Epic

panels.description: The average time spent in each state of a requirement, including all history states that have been used.

targets.rawSql:
with operation_history as(
	SELECT
		jc.issue_id,
		jc.created as operation_time,
		jci.changelog_id,
		jci.from,
		jci.from_string,
		jci.to,
		jci.to_string,
		ji.created as issue_creation_time,
		case 
			when lag(jc.created) over(PARTITION BY jc.issue_id ORDER BY jc.created ASC) is not null then
			TIMESTAMPDIFF(MINUTE, lag(jc.created) over(PARTITION BY jc.issue_id ORDER BY jc.created ASC), jc.created)
			else TIMESTAMPDIFF(MINUTE, ji.created, jc.created) end as time_in_status
	FROM
		jira_changelogs jc
		JOIN jira_changelog_items jci ON jc.changelog_id = jci.changelog_id
		JOIN jira_issues ji ON jc.issue_id = ji.issue_id
		join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
	WHERE
		jci.field = 'status'
		and ji.std_type = 'Requirement'
		and ji.std_status = 'Resolved'
		and $__timeFilter(ji.resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

SELECT
  now() as time,
	from_string as "Requirement Status",
	avg(time_in_status)/1440 as "Time in Status"
FROM operation_history
GROUP BY 1,2
ORDER BY 3 desc

panels.title: Average Requirement Lead Time by Status

panels.description:
1. Compare the average time spent in each state of a requirement in the last 2 months.
2. The requirements being calculated are the requirements delivered in the last 2 months.

targets.rawSql:
with status_change_history as(
	SELECT
		jc.issue_id,
		jc.created as operation_time,
		jci.changelog_id,
		jci.from,
		jci.from_string,
		jci.to,
		jci.to_string,
		ji.created as issue_creation_time,
		lag(jc.created) over(PARTITION BY jc.issue_id ORDER BY jc.created ASC) as last_operation_time,
		case 
			when lag(jc.created) over(PARTITION BY jc.issue_id ORDER BY jc.created ASC) is not null then
			TIMESTAMPDIFF(MINUTE, lag(jc.created) over(PARTITION BY jc.issue_id ORDER BY jc.created ASC), jc.created)
			else TIMESTAMPDIFF(MINUTE, ji.created, jc.created) end as time_in_status
	FROM
		jira_changelogs jc
		JOIN jira_changelog_items jci ON jc.changelog_id = jci.changelog_id
		JOIN jira_issues ji ON jc.issue_id = ji.issue_id
		join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
	WHERE
		jci.field = 'status'
		and ji.std_type = 'Requirement'
		and ji.std_status = 'Resolved'
		and $__timeFilter(ji.resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
),

time_in_status as(
	SELECT 
		DATE_ADD(date(issue_creation_time), INTERVAL -DAY(date(issue_creation_time))+1 DAY) as time,
		from_string,
		avg(time_in_status)/60 as time_in_status
	FROM status_change_history
	GROUP BY 1,2
),

last_month as(
	select 
		DATE_ADD(date(CURDATE()), INTERVAL -DAY(date(CURDATE()))+1 DAY) as last_month
),

month_before_last_month as(
	SELECT 
		DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD(date(CURDATE()), INTERVAL -DAY(date(CURDATE()))+1 DAY), INTERVAL -1 MONTH) as two_month_before
),


last_month_record as(
	SELECT
		from_string as issue_status,
		case when time in (SELECT last_month from last_month) then time_in_status else null end as last_month
	from time_in_status
	WHERE 
		time in (SELECT last_month from last_month)
),

two_month_before_record as(
	SELECT
		from_string as issue_status,
		case when time in (SELECT two_month_before from month_before_last_month) then time_in_status else null end as two_month_before
	from time_in_status
	WHERE 
		time in (SELECT two_month_before from month_before_last_month)
)

SELECT
	now() as time,
	mbr.two_month_before AS "The Month Before Last",
	lmr.last_month AS "Last Month",
	lmr.issue_status
FROM last_month_record lmr
left join two_month_before_record mbr on lmr.issue_status = mbr.issue_status

panels.title: Average Requirement Lead Time by Status in Last 2 Months

panels.description:
1. Total number of requirements created.
2. The requirements being calculated are filtered by "requirement creation time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
select 
  now() as time,
  count(*) as value
from jira_issues ji
  join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
where 
  std_type = 'Requirement'
  and created is not null 
  and $__timeFilter(created)
  and jbi.board_id = $board_id
group by 1;

panels.title: Requirement Count

panels.description:
1. The number of requirements created over time.
2. The time granularity can be switched to week or month by "Time Interval" above. 
3. When Time Interval is set to "month", the requirement_count of "2021-06-01" refers to the number of requirements whose creation time falls under [2020-06-01, 2020-07-01)

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select
    ji.issue_id,
    DATE_ADD(date(created), INTERVAL -$interval(date(created))+1 DAY) as time
  from
    jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and created is not null 
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select
  timestamp(time) as time,
  count(distinct issue_id) as requirement_count
from _requirement
group by 1
order by 1 asc

panels.title: Requirement Count over Time

panels.description: 1. The number of requirements under different Jira Epics.

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select
    ji.issue_id,
    ji.epic_key
  from
    jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and created is not null
    and epic_key is not null
    and epic_key != ''
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  now() as time,
  epic_key as "Epic Key",
  count(*) as value
from _requirement
group by 1,2
order by 3 desc
limit 20

panels.title: Requirement Count by Epic

panels.description:
1. Number of requirements that have been delivered.
2. A requirement is delivered when its status equals 'delivered'.
3. The requirements being calculated are filtered by "requirement creation time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
select
  now() as time,
  count(*) as delivered_count
from jira_issues ji
  join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
where 
  std_type = 'Requirement'
  and ji.std_status = 'Resolved'
  and $__timeFilter(created)
  and jbi.board_id = $board_id

panels.title: Delivered Requirement Count

panels.description: Delivered Requirement Count/Requirement Count (Total)

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select
    count(distinct ji.issue_id) as total_count,
    count(distinct case when ji.std_status = 'Resolved' then ji.issue_id else null end) as delivered_count
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)


select 
  now() as time,
  1.0 * delivered_count/total_count as requirement_delivery_rate
from _requirement

panels.title: Requirement Delivery Rate

panels.description:
1. The requirement delivery rate over time.
2. When Time Interval is set to "month", value "requirement_delivery_rate" of "2021-06-01" calculates the requirements whose creation time falls under [2020-06-01, 2020-07-01)

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select
    DATE_ADD(date(created), INTERVAL -$interval(date(created))+1 DAY) as time,
    count(distinct ji.issue_id) as total_count,
    count(distinct case when ji.std_status = 'Resolved' then ji.issue_id else null end) as delivered_count
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
  group by 1
)


select 
  timestamp(time) as time,
  1.0 * delivered_count/total_count as requirement_delivery_rate
from _requirement
order by 1

panels.title: Requirement Delivery Rate over Time

panels.description: The average delivery rate of requirements under different Jira Epics.

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select
    ji.epic_key as metric,
    count(distinct ji.issue_id) as total_count,
    count(distinct case when ji.std_status = 'Resolved' then ji.issue_id else null end) as delivered_count
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and epic_key is not null
    and epic_key != ''
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
  group by 1
)


select 
  now() as time,
  metric,
  1.0 * delivered_count/total_count as requirement_delivery_rate
from _requirement
order by 3 desc
limit 20

panels.title: Requirement Delivery Rate by Epic

panels.description:
1. The average story point (workload) of requirements.
2. The requirements being calculated are filtered by "requirement creation time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
select 
  now() as time,
  avg(std_story_point) as value
from jira_issues ji
  join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
where 
  std_type = 'Requirement'
  and std_story_point != 0
  and $__timeFilter(created)
  and jbi.board_id = $board_id
group by 1;

panels.title: Avg Requirement Granunarity(Story Point)

panels.description:
1. The story point/estimated hours at which 80% requirements' story point/estimated hours lies below it.
2. The requirements being calculated are filtered by "requirement creation time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    std_story_point,
    percent_rank() over (order by std_story_point asc) as ranks
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and std_story_point != 0
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select
  now() as time,
  max(std_story_point) as value
from _ranks
where 
  ranks <= 0.8
group by 1

panels.title: 80th Percentile Requirement Granunarity(Story point)

panels.description: The average and 80th percentile requirement granularity over time.

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select 
    ji.issue_id,
    DATE_ADD(date(resolution_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(resolution_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    std_story_point
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and std_story_point != 0
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  timestamp(time) as time,
  avg(std_story_point) as average_story_point
from _requirement
group by 1
order by 1 asc

panels.title: Requirement Granularity over Time

panels.description:
1. The cumulative distribution of requirement granularity.
2. Each point refers to the percent rank of a value of granularity.

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    round(std_story_point) as std_story_point
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and std_story_point != 0
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
  order by std_story_point asc
)

select 
  now() as time,
  lpad(std_story_point, 4, ' ') as metric,
  percent_rank() over (order by std_story_point asc) as value
from _ranks
order by std_story_point asc

panels.title: Requirement Granularity (Cumulative Distribution)

options.content: Bug Metrics

panels.description:
1. Total number of bugs created.
2. The bugs being calculated are filtered by "bug creation time" (time filter at the upper-right corner)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  now() as time,
  count(*) as value
FROM
  jira_issues ji
  join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
WHERE
  std_type = 'Bug'
  and jbi.board_id = $board_id
  and $__timeFilter(created)

panels.title: Number of Bugs found in Testing

panels.description:
1. Number of bugs created over time.
2. The time granularity can be switched to week or month by "Time Interval" above. 
3. When Time Interval is set to "month", bug_count of "2021-06-01" calculates the bugs whose creation time falls under [2020-06-01, 2020-07-01)

targets.rawSql:
with _bugs as (
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(ji.created), INTERVAL -$interval(date(ji.created))+1 DAY) as time,
    count(distinct ji.issue_id) as bug_count
  FROM
    jira_issues ji
    LEFT JOIN jira_board_issues jbi ON jbi.issue_id = ji.issue_id
  WHERE
    std_type = 'Bug'
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
    and $__timeFilter(ji.created)
  group by 1
  order by 1
) 

select 
  timestamp(time) as time,
  bug_count
from _bugs

panels.title: Number of Bugs found in Testing over Time

panels.description:
1. The average bug age.
2. Bug age refers to the length of time from bug creation to resolution.
3. The bugs being calculated are filtered by "bug resolution time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board"("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
select 
  now() as time,
  avg(lead_time/1440) as value
from jira_issues ji
  join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
where 
  std_type = 'Bug'
  and std_status = 'Resolved'
  and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
  and jbi.board_id = $board_id
group by 1;

panels.title: Average Bug Age (day)

panels.description:
1. The bug age at which 80% bugsâ€˜ age lies below it.
2. The bugs being calculated are filtered by "bug resolution time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    ji.lead_time,
    percent_rank() over (order by lead_time asc) as ranks
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Bug'
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select
  now() as time,
  max(lead_time/1440) as value
from _ranks
where 
  ranks <= 0.8
group by 1

panels.title: 80th Percentile Bug Age (day)

panels.description:
1. The average and 80th percentile bug age over time.
2. The time granularity can be switched to Week or Month by "Time Interval" above. 
3. When Time Interval is set to "Month", the average_bug_age of "2021-06-01" refers to the average age of bugs whose resolution time falls under [2020-06-01, 2020-07-01).

targets.rawSql:
with _bugs as(
  select 
    ji.issue_id,
    DATE_ADD(date(resolution_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(resolution_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    lead_time,
    round(lead_time/1440) as lead_time_day
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Bug'
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  timestamp(time) as time,
  avg(lead_time/1440) as "Average Lead Time"
from _bugs
group by 1
order by 1 asc

panels.title: Average Bug Age over Time

panels.description:
1. The cumulative distribution of bug age. 
2. Each point refers to the percent rank of a bug age.

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    round(ji.lead_time/1440) as lead_time_day
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Bug'
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
  order by lead_time_day asc
)

select 
  now() as time,
  lpad(concat(lead_time_day,'d'), 4, ' ') as metric,
  percent_rank() over (order by lead_time_day asc) as value
from _ranks
order by lead_time_day asc

panels.title: Bug Age (Cumulative Distribution)

panels.description: The average time spent on fixing bugs under different Jira Epics.

targets.rawSql:
with _bugs as(
  select
    ji.issue_id,
    ji.epic_key,
    ji.lead_time
  from
    jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Bug'
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and epic_key is not null
    and epic_key != ''
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  now() as time,
  epic_key as "Epic Key",
  avg(lead_time)/1440 as "Bug Age"
from _bugs
group by 1,2
order by 3 desc
limit 20

panels.title: Average Bug Age by Epic

options.content: Incident Metrics

panels.description:
1. Total number of incidents created.
2. The incidents being calculated are filtered by "incident creation time" (time filter at the upper-right corner)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  now() as time,
  count(*) as value
FROM
  jira_issues ji
  join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
WHERE
  std_type = 'Incident'
  and jbi.board_id = $board_id
  and $__timeFilter(created)

panels.title: Number of Incidents found after shipping

panels.description:
1. Number of incidents created over time.
2. The time granularity can be switched to week or month by "Time Interval" above. 
3. When Time Interval is set to "month", incident_count of "2021-06-01" calculates the incidents whose creation time falls under [2020-06-01, 2020-07-01)

targets.rawSql:
with _incidents as (
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(ji.created), INTERVAL -$interval(date(ji.created))+1 DAY) as time,
    count(distinct ji.issue_id) as incident_count
  FROM
    jira_issues ji
    LEFT JOIN jira_board_issues jbi ON jbi.issue_id = ji.issue_id
  WHERE
    std_type = 'Incident'
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
    and $__timeFilter(ji.created)
  group by 1
  order by 1
) 

select 
  timestamp(time) as time,
  incident_count
from _incidents

panels.title: Number of Incidents found after shipping over Time

panels.description:
1. The average incident age.
2. Incident age refers to the length of time from incident creation to resolution.
3. The incidents being calculated are filtered by "incident resolution time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board"("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
select 
  now() as time,
  avg(lead_time/1440) as value
from jira_issues ji
  join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
where 
  std_type = 'Incident'
  and std_status = 'Resolved'
  and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
  and jbi.board_id = $board_id
group by 1;

panels.title: Average Incident Age (day)

panels.description:
1. The incident age at which 80% incidentsâ€˜ age lies below it.
2. The incidents being calculated are filtered by "incident resolution time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    ji.lead_time,
    percent_rank() over (order by lead_time asc) as ranks
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Incident'
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select
  now() as time,
  max(lead_time/1440) as value
from _ranks
where 
  ranks <= 0.8
group by 1

panels.title: 80th Percentile Incident Age (day)

panels.description:
1. The average and 80th percentile incident age over time.
2. The time granularity can be switched to Week or Month by "Time Interval" above. 
3. When Time Interval is set to "Month", the average_incident_age of "2021-06-01" refers to the average age of incidents whose resolution time falls under [2020-06-01, 2020-07-01).

targets.rawSql:
with _incidents as(
  select 
    ji.issue_id,
    DATE_ADD(date(resolution_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(resolution_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    lead_time,
    round(lead_time/1440) as lead_time_day
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Incident'
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  timestamp(time) as time,
  avg(lead_time/1440) as "Average Lead Time"
from _incidents
group by 1
order by 1 asc

panels.title: Average Incident Age over Time

panels.description:
1. The cumulative distribution of incident age.
2. Each point refers to the percent rank of a incident age.

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    round(ji.lead_time/1440) as lead_time_day
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Incident'
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
  order by lead_time_day asc
)

select 
  now() as time,
  lpad(concat(lead_time_day,'d'), 4, ' ') as metric,
  percent_rank() over (order by lead_time_day asc) as value
from _ranks
order by lead_time_day asc

panels.title: Incident Age (Cumulative Distribution)

panels.description: The average time spent on fixing incidents under different Jira Epics.

targets.rawSql:
with _incidents as(
  select
    ji.issue_id,
    ji.epic_key,
    ji.lead_time
  from
    jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.issue_id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Incident'
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and epic_key is not null
    and epic_key != ''
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  now() as time,
  epic_key as "Epic Key",
  avg(lead_time)/1440 as "Incident Age"
from _incidents
group by 1,2
order by 3 desc
limit 20

panels.title: Average Incident Age by Epic

list.definition: select distinct concat(name, ': ', board_id) from jira_boards
list.label: Choose Board
list.name: board_id
list.query: select distinct concat(name, ': ', board_id) from jira_boards
